post_text:
Hardworking employees should be rewarded in order be motivated to continue their job.  There are some cases when the employee should ask for the promotion by himself. How to do it professionally? The sample below will show.

From:

Jock Jackson
Marketing department
AAA service LTD
2323 Verona street
London, UK

To:

Mr.jackHompson
General director
AAA service LTD
2323 verona street
London, UK

26th Aug 2013.

Dear Sir,

SUBJECT: APPLICATION LETTER FOR PROMOTION

I am writing this letter in order to ask you for the promotion. In order not to keep you long for reading this letter I will mention the reason that forces me to ask for the promotion within a company. I am working with AAA services during 5 years. I have started as a marketing executive. I thank you for the provided opportunity. During these five years I have gained a lot of  experience and qualification.

I strongly believe that after five years I can be considered as a candidate for promotion since I feel the potential that can be realised on the new level. I enjoy working in our company and don’t want to quit. Kindly ask you to consider me as a candidate for the promotion. If you need further details I am available for the personal meeting.

Thank you in advance,

Sincerely,

Jock Jackson
